blocks.description:
Configures the download directory for Terraform modules.

* Use this block to specify where Terraform modules should be downloaded.
* Allows customizing the download location and cleanup behavior.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: Path where modules should be downloaded.

attributes.name: clean
attributes.description: Whether to clean the directory before downloads.

blocks.description:
Defines commands to run before Terraform operations.

* Use this block to execute commands before specific Terraform commands.
* Supports multiple hooks with different triggers and commands.

attributes.name: commands
attributes.description: List of Terraform commands that trigger this hook.

attributes.name: execute
attributes.description: Command to execute.

attributes.name: working_dir
attributes.description: Working directory for the command.

attributes.name: run_on_error
attributes.description: Whether to run the hook even if previous hooks failed.

blocks.description:
Defines commands to run after Terraform operations.

* Use this block to execute commands after specific Terraform commands.
* Supports multiple hooks with different triggers and commands.

attributes.name: commands
attributes.description: List of Terraform commands that trigger this hook.

attributes.name: execute
attributes.description: Command to execute.

attributes.name: working_dir
attributes.description: Working directory for the command.

attributes.name: run_on_error
attributes.description: Whether to run the hook even if Terraform command failed.

blocks.description:
Configures the duration for assumed IAM roles.

* Use this block to specify how long assumed IAM roles should remain valid.
* Helpful for long-running Terraform operations.

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: Duration for the assumed role session.

blocks.description:
Configures SOPS encryption settings.

* Use this block to specify SOPS configuration for encrypted files.
* Supports various encryption providers and key configurations.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: Path to the SOPS configuration file.

attributes.name: provider
attributes.description: The encryption provider to use.

blocks.description: Contains all the configurations for handling errors. Supports different nested configuration blocks like retry and ignore to define specific error-handling strategies.
Defines rules for retrying operations when specific errors occur. Useful for handling intermittent errors that may resolve after a short delay or multiple attempts.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the retry configuration block

attributes.name: retryable_errors
attributes.description: A list of regex patterns to match errors that are eligible to be retried

attributes.name: max_attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of retry attempts

attributes.name: sleep_interval_sec
attributes.description: Time (in seconds) to wait between retries

blocks.description: Defines rules for ignoring specific errors. Useful when certain errors are known to be safe and should not prevent the run from proceeding.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the ignore configuration block

attributes.name: ignorable_errors
attributes.description: A list of regex patterns to define errors to ignore. Patterns starting with ! indicate errors that should not be ignored

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: A warning message displayed when an error is ignored

attributes.name: signals
attributes.description: Key-value pairs used to emit signals to external systems. Results in a JSON file named error-signals.json being emitted on failure

blocks.description: Provides advanced configuration options to dynamically determine when and how specific units in the Terragrunt dependency graph are excluded. This feature allows for fine-grained control over which actions are executed and can conditionally exclude dependencies.

attributes.name: if
attributes.description: Condition to dynamically determine whether the unit should be excluded

attributes.name: actions
attributes.description: Specifies which actions to exclude when the condition is met

attributes.name: exclude_dependencies
attributes.description: Indicates whether the dependencies of the excluded unit should also be excluded (default: false)

blocks.description: Configures feature flags in HCL for a specific Terragrunt Unit. Each feature flag must include a default value. Feature flags can be overridden via the --feature CLI option or TERRAGRUNT_FEATURE environment variable.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the feature flag

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: The default value of the feature flag. This value is evaluated as an expression dynamically at runtime.

examples.description: Dynamic feature flag using external command

blocks.description: Used to arbitrarily generate a file in the terragrunt working directory. This can be used to generate common OpenTofu/Terraform configurations that are shared across multiple OpenTofu/Terraform modules.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name to differentiate between multiple generate blocks

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The path where the generated file should be written. If a relative path, it'll be relative to the Terragrunt working dir

attributes.name: if_exists
attributes.description: What to do if a file already exists at path

attributes.name: if_disabled
attributes.description: What to do if a file already exists at path and disable is set to true (skip by default)

attributes.name: comment_prefix
attributes.description: A prefix that can be used to indicate comments in the generated file. Used by terragrunt to write out a signature for knowing which files were generated by terragrunt. Defaults to #

attributes.name: disable_signature
attributes.description: When true, disables including a signature in the generated file. This means that there will be no difference between overwrite_terragrunt and overwrite for the if_exists setting. Defaults to false

attributes.name: contents
attributes.description: The contents of the generated file

attributes.name: disable
attributes.description: Disables this generate block

blocks.description: Used to enumerate all the Terragrunt modules that need to be applied in order for this module to be able to apply. This is purely for ordering the operations when using run-all commands of OpenTofu/Terraform. This does not expose or pull in the outputs like dependency blocks.

attributes.name: paths
attributes.description: A list of paths to modules that should be marked as a dependency

blocks.description: Used to configure module dependencies. Each dependency block exports the outputs of the target module as block attributes you can reference throughout the configuration.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name to differentiate between dependency blocks. Can be referenced using dependency.<name>.outputs

attributes.name: config_path
attributes.description: Path to a Terragrunt module (folder with a terragrunt.hcl file) that should be included as a dependency in this configuration

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: When false, excludes the dependency from execution. Defaults to true

attributes.name: skip_outputs
attributes.description: When true, skip calling terragrunt output when processing this dependency. If mock_outputs is configured, set outputs to the value of mock_outputs. Otherwise, outputs will be set to an empty map

attributes.name: mock_outputs
attributes.description: A map of arbitrary key value pairs to use as the outputs attribute when no outputs are available from the target module, or if skip_outputs is true

attributes.name: mock_outputs_allowed_terraform_commands
attributes.description: A list of Terraform commands for which mock_outputs are allowed

attributes.name: mock_outputs_merge_with_state
attributes.description: DEPRECATED. Use mock_outputs_merge_strategy_with_state. When true, mock_outputs and the state outputs will be merged

attributes.name: mock_outputs_merge_strategy_with_state
attributes.description: Specifies how any existing state should be merged into the mocks

blocks.description:
Configures retry behavior for Terragrunt operations.

* Use this block to specify retry settings for failed operations.
* Allows customization of retry attempts, error patterns, and delay between retries.

attributes.name: max_attempts
attributes.description: Maximum number of retry attempts.

attributes.name: sleep_interval_sec
attributes.description: Number of seconds to wait between retry attempts.

attributes.name: error_regex_patterns
attributes.description: List of regex patterns to match against error messages for retry.

blocks.description: Used to configure how Terragrunt will interact with OpenTofu/Terraform. This includes specifying source location, extra arguments, and command hooks.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: Specifies where to find OpenTofu/Terraform configuration files. Supports local paths, Git URLs, and registry modules using tfr protocol

attributes.name: include_in_copy
attributes.description: List of glob patterns that should always be copied into the OpenTofu/Terraform working directory

attributes.name: exclude_from_copy
attributes.description: List of glob patterns that should always be skipped when copying into the OpenTofu/Terraform working directory

attributes.name: copy_terraform_lock_file
attributes.description: Whether to copy the generated or existing .terraform.lock.hcl from the temp folder into the working directory

blocks.description: Specify extra CLI arguments to pass to the terraform binary

attributes.name: arguments
attributes.description: List of CLI arguments to pass to terraform

attributes.name: commands
attributes.description: List of terraform sub commands that the arguments will be passed to

attributes.name: env_vars
attributes.description: Map of key value pairs to set as environment variables

attributes.name: required_var_files
attributes.description: List of file paths to Terraform vars files that will be passed as -var-file

attributes.name: optional_var_files
attributes.description: Like required_var_files, but any files that do not exist are ignored

blocks.description: Command hooks that should run before terraform is called

attributes.name: commands
attributes.description: List of terraform sub commands for which the hook should run before

attributes.name: execute
attributes.description: List of command and arguments that should be run as the hook

attributes.name: working_dir
attributes.description: The path to set as the working directory of the hook

attributes.name: run_on_error
attributes.description: If true, this hook will run even if a previous hook hit an error

attributes.name: suppress_stdout
attributes.description: If true, the stdout output of the executed commands will be suppressed

blocks.description: Command hooks that should run after terraform is called

attributes.name: commands
attributes.description: List of terraform sub commands for which the hook should run after

attributes.name: execute
attributes.description: List of command and arguments that should be run as the hook

attributes.name: working_dir
attributes.description: The path to set as the working directory of the hook

attributes.name: run_on_error
attributes.description: If true, this hook will run even if terraform command hit an error

attributes.name: suppress_stdout
attributes.description: If true, the stdout output of the executed commands will be suppressed

blocks.description: Command hooks that run when an error is thrown

attributes.name: commands
attributes.description: List of terraform sub commands for which the hook should run on error

attributes.name: execute
attributes.description: List of command and arguments that should be run as the hook

attributes.name: on_errors
attributes.description: List of error expressions that will trigger this hook

attributes.name: working_dir
attributes.description: The path to set as the working directory of the hook

attributes.name: suppress_stdout
attributes.description: If true, the stdout output of the executed commands will be suppressed

blocks.description: Includes other Terragrunt configurations, allowing for modular and reusable configurations.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The path to the Terragrunt configuration file to include.

attributes.name: expose
attributes.description: Whether to expose the included configuration to other configurations that include this one.

attributes.name: merge_strategy
attributes.description: Strategy to use when merging configurations.

blocks.description: Used to define aliases for Terragrunt expressions that can be referenced elsewhere in configuration. Local variables can be simple values or complex types like lists and maps, and are available under the reference local.<local name> throughout the file where the locals block is defined.

examples.description: Complex locals with lists and maps
Locals with file reading and computation

blocks.description: Used to configure how Terragrunt will set up the remote state configuration of your OpenTofu/Terraform code. Supports special processing of config attributes for s3 and gcs backends.

attributes.name: backend
attributes.description: Specifies which remote state backend will be configured. Should be one of the available backends that OpenTofu/Terraform supports

attributes.name: disable_init
attributes.description: When true, skip automatic initialization of the backend by Terragrunt. Currently s3 and gcs are the two backends with support for automatic creation

attributes.name: disable_dependency_optimization
attributes.description: When true, disable optimized dependency fetching for terragrunt modules using this remote_state block

attributes.name: generate
attributes.description: Configure Terragrunt to automatically generate a .tf file that configures the remote state backend

path.description: The path where the generated file should be written

if_exists.description: What to do if a file already exists at path

attributes.name: config
attributes.description: Map used to fill in the backend configuration in OpenTofu/Terraform. For s3 and gcs backends, supports additional properties for automatic initialization

attributes.name: encryption
attributes.description: Map used to configure state and plan encryption in OpenTofu

blocks.description: A map used to specify input variables and their values to pass to OpenTofu/Terraform. Each entry is passed using TF_VAR_ environment variables with json-encoded values. Note: The actual type information must be correctly specified in the Terraform variable declarations.
notes: Variables set through inputs block will have lower precedence than explicit TF_VAR_ environment variables
Variables set through inputs will have higher precedence than terraform.tfvars files
Variables set through inputs will have higher precedence than *.auto.tfvars files
Variables set through inputs will have higher precedence than -var and -var-file options

blocks.description: Configures provider settings for Terraform.

globalAttributes.name: terraform_version_constraint
globalAttributes.description: Specifies the required Terraform version for the configuration.

globalAttributes.name: terragrunt_version_constraint
globalAttributes.description: Specifies the required Terragrunt version for the configuration.

globalAttributes.name: download_dir
globalAttributes.description:
Specifies the directory for downloaded Terraform configurations.

* Used to override the default download directory.
* Precedence (highest to lowest):
  1. --terragrunt-download-dir command line option
  2. TERRAGRUNT_DOWNLOAD environment variable
  3. download_dir attribute in module's terragrunt.hcl
  4. download_dir attribute in included terragrunt.hcl
* Supports all terragrunt functions (e.g., path_relative_from_include())

value.description: Path to the download directory. Can include terragrunt function calls.

globalAttributes.name: prevent_destroy
globalAttributes.description:
Prevents the destruction of resources in protected modules.

* When set to true, prevents terraform destroy and destroy-all commands from destroying the module's resources
* Useful for protecting critical infrastructure components like databases or authentication systems
* Acts as a safety mechanism to prevent accidental destruction of important resources

value.description: When true, prevents destruction of the module's resources

globalAttributes.name: skip
globalAttributes.description:
DEPRECATED: Use exclude instead.

* When set to true, all terragrunt commands will skip the selected module
* Useful for:
  - Modules you don't want any changes to
  - Modules that don't define any infrastructure by themselves
  - Root level terragrunt.hcl files used only for configuration reuse
* Can be inherited from included terragrunt.hcl files
* Inheritance can be overridden by explicitly redefining skip in the current module

value.description: When true, terragrunt will skip processing this module for all commands

globalAttributes.deprecationMessage: Use exclude block instead of skip

globalAttributes.name: iam_role
globalAttributes.description:
Specifies an IAM role that Terragrunt should assume before invoking OpenTofu/Terraform.

* Precedence (highest to lowest):
  1. --terragrunt-iam-role command line option
  2. TERRAGRUNT_IAM_ROLE env variable
  3. iam_role attribute in module's terragrunt.hcl
  4. iam_role attribute in included terragrunt.hcl
* Can reference local variables
* Can be included from other HCL files through include

value.description: ARN of the IAM role to assume

globalAttributes.name: iam_assume_role_duration
globalAttributes.description:
Specifies the STS session duration (in seconds) for the assumed IAM role.

* Precedence (highest to lowest):
  1. --terragrunt-iam-assume-role-duration command line option
  2. TERRAGRUNT_IAM_ASSUME_ROLE_DURATION env variable
  3. iam_assume_role_duration attribute in module's terragrunt.hcl
  4. iam_assume_role_duration attribute in included terragrunt.hcl

value.description: Duration in seconds for the assumed role session

globalAttributes.name: iam_assume_role_session_name
globalAttributes.description:
Specifies the STS session name for the assumed IAM role.

* Precedence (highest to lowest):
  1. --terragrunt-iam-assume-role-session-name command line option
  2. TERRAGRUNT_IAM_ASSUME_ROLE_SESSION_NAME env variable
  3. iam_assume_role_session_name attribute in module's terragrunt.hcl
  4. iam_assume_role_session_name attribute in included terragrunt.hcl

value.description: Session name for the assumed role

globalAttributes.name: iam_web_identity_token
globalAttributes.description:
Used with iam_role to assume a role using AssumeRoleWithWebIdentity.

* Can be set to either a token value or path to a token file
* Enables running terragrunt in CI/CD pipelines without static AWS credentials
* Precedence (highest to lowest):
  1. --terragrunt-iam-web-identity-token command line option
  2. TERRAGRUNT_IAM_ASSUME_ROLE_WEB_IDENTITY_TOKEN env variable
  3. iam_web_identity_token attribute in module's terragrunt.hcl
  4. iam_web_identity_token attribute in included terragrunt.hcl

value.description: Either the web identity token value or path to the token file

globalAttributes.name: terraform_binary
globalAttributes.description:
Overrides the default binary Terragrunt calls (which is tofu).

* Precedence (highest to lowest):
  1. --terragrunt-tfpath command line option
  2. TERRAGRUNT_TFPATH env variable
  3. terragrunt.hcl in module directory
  4. included terragrunt.hcl

value.description: Path or name of the terraform binary to use

globalAttributes.name: terraform_version_constraint
globalAttributes.description:
Overrides the default minimum supported version of OpenTofu/Terraform.

* Useful when an older version of OpenTofu/Terraform is needed
* Terragrunt usually only officially supports the latest version

globalAttributes.name: terragrunt_version_constraint
globalAttributes.description:
Specifies which versions of the Terragrunt CLI can be used with your configuration.

* Terragrunt will exit with an error if the running version doesn't match the constraints

globalAttributes.name: retryable_errors
globalAttributes.description:
DEPRECATED: Use errors instead.

* Overrides the default list of retryable errors with a custom list
* Uses regex patterns to match error messages
* Includes a comprehensive default list of common retryable errors
globalAttributes.deprecationMessage: Use errors block instead of retryable_errors

value.description: List of regex patterns matching retryable errors
